choices.A: It must run the same operating system as its host.
choices.C: It must be aware of other virtual machines, in order to allocate physical resources for them.
choices.D: It relies on hypervisors to allocate computing resources for it.
choices.B: It is deployable without a hypervisor to host it.

read -> load -> dump -> write 
make sense!!

given answer is correct

The script reads a JSON file, modifies an IP address within the JSON structure, and then saves the modified JSON in both compact and indented formats into two separate files.
given ans should be correct

This is what I can gather

1. Open some file which contains json data.
2. Read that entire file into a string (json.read)
3. Converts the json string into a python dictionary array (json.load)
4. Modify the IP address of Gi0 to 192.168.1.2 in the python dictionary array
5. Convert the python dictionary array into back to a json string without identation (json.dump)
6 Convert the python dictionary array into back to a json string with indentation (json.dump)
7. Write the json string with and without identation to 2 seperate files (json.write)

So I think the provided answer is correct.

questions.question_text: Which characteristic applies to a traditional WAN solution but not to a Cisco SD-WAN solution?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Without knowing anything about SD-WAN, you can answer this question with no problem. If you want your technology shines among others, you should talk about the bad things other technologies have.

Answer A has the only con, so it the correct one for this question.

Selected Answer: A
Traditional WAN : relies on hardware and software from specific vendors, is more complex to deploy and manage, has higher costs, and has poor cloud support.
Cisco SD-WAN : Based on software-defined architecture, it has strong flexibility, easy deployment, centralized management, and is optimized for cloud applications, making the cost more competitive.

Selected Answer: A
A is correct

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. An engineer must prevent VLAN 20 routes from appearing in the routing table of Switch-1. Which command set must be applied?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
This configuration applies an inbound distribute-list on Switch-1 for OSPF, denying routes from the specified network (192.168.2.0/24).

Selected Answer: D
D is correct but there is supposed to be "permit any"

This question is also not appropriate: all OSPF routes will no longer appear in the SW1 
 routing table. don't forget the implicit deny in the ACL.

Too many Cisco exam questions are terrible.

Selected Answer: D
D is correct
